intro: Calpidia oblonga, commonly known as the narrowleaf calpidia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Calpidia oblonga thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often found in dry grasslands and rocky slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
